column2: Meaning
column5: Sentence

column2: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion
column5: an arduous journey

column2: with suspicion or disapproval
column5: the reformers looked askance at the mystical tradition

column2: support and strengthen
column5: the fall in interest rates is starting to bolster confidence

column2: lacking grace in movement or posture
column5: the cold made his fingers clumsy

column2: sorrow for sin arising from fear of damnation
column5: to show contrition for his crime he offered to do community service

column2: harmful to living things
column5: divorce is assumed to have deleterious effects on children

column2: compulsory force or threat
column5: confessions extracted under duress

column2: enlightening or uplifting so as to encourage improvement
column5: edifying literature

column2: giving the power to produce an intended result
column5: the vaccine has proved both efficacious and safe

column2: call forth, as an emotion, feeling, or response
column5: they invariably elicit exclamations of approval from guests

column2: a state of constant change
column5: It was considered such ideal fluxing ore that the El Paso smelter paid the costs for shipping it by rail and processed the ore at no charge to assure a steady supply.

column2: troubled persistently, especially with petty annoyances
column5: harried detectives answer ringing phones

column2: deserving or bringing disgrace or shame
column5: no other party risked ignominious defeat

column2: not quick or skillful in action or thought
column5: both men are unhappy about the maladroit way the matter has been handled

column2: someone who exhibits independence in thought and action
column5: a maverick among Connecticut Republicans

column2: the tendency to be untruthful
column5: people publicly castigated for past mendacity

column2: interpret in the wrong way
column5: my advice was deliberately misconstrued

column2: found in the ordinary course of events
column5: seeking a way out of his mundane, humdrum existence

column2: filled with bewilderment
column5: he would be completely nonplussed and embarrassed at the idea

column2: a subtle difference in meaning or opinion or attitude
column5: the effect of the music is nuanced by the social situation of listeners

column2: wealth as evidenced by sumptuous living
column5: rooms of spectacular opulence

column2: cause to be more favorably inclined
column5: they attempted to placate the students with promises

column2: take as a given; assume as a postulate or axiom
column5: the Confucian view posits a perfectible human nature

column2: an act or expression of criticism and censure
column5: she had rebuked him for drinking too much

column2: plausible but false
column5: a specious argument

column2: demanding strict attention to rules and procedures
column5: California's air pollution guidelines are stringent

column2: showing a brooding ill humor
column5: When I mentioned this, he lapsed back into the sullens.

column2: lasting a very short time
column5: The law had been applied to hotels and motels to collect a tax from transients, vacationers, and travelers, who stay overnight in Alabama.
